groups.title: Prevent (Prepare)
items: Verify contact lists for Incident Commander, Technical Lead, ECS, vendors, and PIO are current and reachable.
Review OT asset inventories, diagrams, and data flows for accuracy.
Confirm backups and golden images are validated with hashes and stored offline.
Run tabletop exercise outcomes into updated runbooks and training.
Check evidence kits (write-once media, chain-of-custody forms) are stocked.

groups.title: Detect (Identify & Investigate)
items: Validate monitoring alerts and suppression lists against current OT changes.
Ensure operators know how to capture screenshots and logs without altering systems.
Test escalation path to Incident Commander and ECS with timestamps recorded.
Review triage criteria and severity definitions with control room staff.
Confirm evidence storage locations are reachable and protected.

groups.title: Respond (Respond & Comms)
items: Log severity declaration with who/when and initial evidence.
Execute containment only with Incident Commander approval and operations coordination.
Record every action (time, actor, rationale) in the incident log.
Route media and external inquiries to PIO; avoid personal channels.
Capture notification log entries for ECS/PSA and internal leadership.

groups.title: Recover & Follow Up
items: Restore using validated clean backups/images with hash verification.
Monitor post-restore systems for recurrence and confirm stability before reconnecting.
Hold a hotwash and document lessons, gaps, and corrective actions.
Store evidence with chain-of-custody and retention metadata.
Update playbooks, checklists, and training content with approved changes.
